title: Ticket #761: matchmaker diagnostics not visible to JobRouter or Quill
description:
In the schedd, LastRejMatchTime, LastRejMatchReason and a few similar things are inserted into the job ClassAd in memory only. This means these attributes are not persistent and they are not visible to JobRouter and Quill.

There is no comment in the code excusing this way of doing things, so I am planning to make it update the ad the normal way, which logs to job_queue.log. I think I would make this a "non-durable" transaction, so we would not fsync after updating these attributes. I would like to do this as a bug fix for 7.4.0, because the documented use-case for JobRouter depends on these attributes.

Todd suggested getting some rough performance numbers for the different methods of updating ClassAds in the schedd. Here's what I got:

Time in seconds to perform 10,000 SetAttributeInt operations, to memory only, NONDURABLE (no fsync), and DURABLE (fsync). 

NO-DISK    NONDURABLE   DURABLE  SYSTEM
0.04       0.2            4      My MacBook
0.04       0.2           50      My MacBook with busy disk
0.03       0.3          300      tonic
0.03       0.3          500      tonic with busy disk

I think the NONDURABLE option demonstrates reasonable performance for something called as frequently as the matchmaker diagnostic updates in the negotiation handler. It's 8-10 times slower than a pure memory update, but it can handle over 10,000 updates per second on the systems I tested. Fortunately, we don't need a DURABLE update, because the performance of that looks a bit more iffy.

I made the disk busy by doing cp -r of CONDOR_SRC.

I confirmed by reading the code that the NONDURABLE option skips both the fsync and the fflush.

The patch I used to test is pasted below. 

diff --git a/src/condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp
b/src/condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp
index e8f5afa..56cf7d9 100644
--- a/src/condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp
+++ b/src/condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp
@@ -5069,6 +5069,29 @@ Scheduler::negotiate(int command, Stream* s)
                     host_cnt = max_hosts + 1;
                     JobsRejected++;
                     cad->Assign(ATTR_LAST_REJ_MATCH_TIME,(int)time(0));
+                    {
+                        time_t tt = time(0);
+                        UtcTime start1(true);
+                        for(int cc=0;cc<10000;cc++) {
+                            cad->Assign(ATTR_LAST_REJ_MATCH_TIME,(int)tt);
+                        }
+                        UtcTime stop1(true);
+                        dprintf(D_ALWAYS,"DAN TESTING: time to update
in memory 10000 times: %f\n",stop1.difference(start1));
+
+                        UtcTime start2(true);
+                        for(int cc=0;cc<10000;cc++) {
+
 SetAttributeInt(id.cluster,id.proc,ATTR_LAST_REJ_MATCH_TIME,(int)tt,NONDURABLE);
+                        }
+                        UtcTime stop2(true);
+                        dprintf(D_ALWAYS,"DAN TESTING: time to update
non-durable 10000 times: %f\n",stop2.difference(start2));
+
+                        UtcTime start3(true);
+                        for(int cc=0;cc<10000;cc++) {
+
 SetAttributeInt(id.cluster,id.proc,ATTR_LAST_REJ_MATCH_TIME,(int)tt);
+                        }
+                        UtcTime stop3(true);
+                        dprintf(D_ALWAYS,"DAN TESTING: time to update
durable 10000 times: %f\n",stop3.difference(start3));
+                    }
                     break;
                 case SEND_JOB_INFO: {
                         // The Negotiator wants us to send it a job.
remarks: I made a patch for 7.4 that changes the in-memory updates to mathcmaking diagnostics into NONDURABLE (to disk with no fsync) updates.
